title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers are expected in the Uva province and in Ampara, Batticaloa and Hambantota districts, the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: NBRO issues advisory as Colombo-Kandy road reopens at Pahala Kadugannawa
byline: The Colombo-Kandy main road, which was temporarily closed at the Pahala Kadugannawa area due to landslides, has been reopened after an interim solution was implemented, the National Building Research Organization (NBRO) said.

title: Over 50 vehicles involved in massive pile-up in Japan, 1 dead, 26 injured
byline: A massive crash in snowy weather killed one person and injured 26 on an expressway in Japan late on Friday as the country kicked off its end-of-the-year holiday season.

title: US airlines cancel over 1,000 flights due to winter storm Devin
byline: Airlines in the United States have canceled or delayed thousands of flights on Friday, according to flight tracking website FlightAware, due to winter storm Devin during peak holiday travel, while some states restricted commercial road traffic in anticipation of snowfall.

title: CID obtains 72-hour detention order on ex-Minister Douglas Devananda
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has obtained a 72-hour detention order to further question former Minister Douglas Devananda, who was arrested yesterday in connection with a missing pistol, said police.

title: Israel becomes first country to formally recognise Somaliland as independent state
byline: Israel became the first country to formally recognise the self-declared Republic of Somaliland as an independent and sovereign state on Friday -- a decision that could reshape regional dynamics and test Somalia’s longstanding opposition to secession.

title: Indian-origin student arrested in US for arson, terrorist threat
byline: A 22-year-old Indian-origin student has been arrested in the US on charges of arson and terroristic threat against family members, according to official records.

title: Ex-Minister Douglas Devananda to appear before court following CID arrest
byline: Former Minister Douglas Devananda, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), is scheduled to be produced before the Gampaha Magistrate’s Court today (27).

title: Nightclub petrol bomb plot foiled in Seeduwa; Six arrested
byline: A group of individuals allegedly preparing to launch a petrol bomb attack on a nightclub in Seeduwa has been arrested, said police.

title: First-ever delay in Christmas Day prisoner release; Dept. confirms imminent release
byline: The Department of Prisons has announced that the release of inmates under the annual Christmas amnesty is expected to take place in the near future.

title: Wild elephant killed in collision with van on Habarana-Trinco road
byline: A wild elephant has been killed after colliding with a van near the 124th Mile Post on the Habarana-Trincomalee main road at around 1:00 a.m. today (27).

title: Bomb scare at Kandy District Secretariat intended to cause public alarm: Police
byline: Sri Lanka Police suspect that the information received regarding the presence of explosives at the Kandy District Secretariat was a deliberate attempt to create public unrest.

title: Govt unshaken by defeat of budgets in LG bodies - Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Labour Mahinda Jayasinghe has stated that the defeat of budgets at local government institutions will have no impact on the continuation of the government.

title: Sri Lanka vehicle importers urge tax relief amid post-disaster sales decline
byline: The President of the Vehicle Importers’ Association of Sri Lanka (VIASL), Prasad Manage, stated that the government should prioritize reducing the prices of small vehicles commonly used by the general public.

title: Sri Lanka among top international destinations for Indian travellers
byline: According to a recent report by MakeMyTrip, Sri Lanka has emerged as the third most booked international destination by Indian travellers for the festive period, following Thailand and the United Arab Emirates (UAE).

title: Gold prices in Sri Lanka increase by Rs. 12,000
byline: Gold rates in the local market continue to rise with the rapid increase in prices in the global market.

title: Thailand and Cambodia sign truce to halt fierce border conflict
byline: Thailand and Cambodia agreed on Saturday to halt weeks of fierce border clashes, the worst fighting in years between the Southeast Asian countries that has included fighter-jet sorties, exchange of rocket fire and artillery barrages.

title: At least 15 dead, 19 injured in Guatemala bus accident
byline: At least 15 people were killed and 19 injured after a passenger bus plunged into a ravine on the Inter-American Highway in western Guatemala, authorities said on Saturday.

title: Zelensky plans to meet Trump on Sunday for talks on ending Russian war
byline: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has said he will meet his US counterpart Donald Trump in Florida on Sunday, as talks continue on ending Russia’s full-scale war.

title: DMC prepares for anticipated increase in rainfall
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) has stated that it has initiated preparedness measures in anticipation of increased rainfall forecast by the Department of Meteorology.

title: 2026 voter registration census to begin on February 1 - PAFFREL
byline: The voter registration census for the year 2026 will commence on February 1, according to the People’s Action for Free and Fair Elections (PAFFREL).

title: Few showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Meteorology Department states that a few showers may occur in the Northern, Eastern and Uva Provinces and in the Polonnaruwa, Matale and Nuwara Eliya districts.

title: FSP urges govt to address economic impact of Cyclone ‘Ditwah’
byline: The Frontline Socialist Party (FSP) has called on the government to issue a clear and direct statement regarding the economic damage caused by Cyclone ‘Ditwah’.

title: China issues drafts rules to regulate AI with human-like interaction
byline: China’s cyber regulator on Saturday issued draft rules for public comment that would tighten oversight of artificial intelligence services designed to simulate human personalities and engage users in emotional interaction.

title: Proposal to hand over Mattala Airport to private companies for PPP project - Minister
byline: A proposal has been prepared to hand over the Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport (MRIA) to private companies under the Public-Private Partnership (PPP) programme, Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation Dr. Anura Karunathilaka said.

title: Woman arrested over showroom manager’s shooting in Ambalangoda
byline: More details have been revealed regarding the shooting and killing of a showroom manager in Ambalangoda, following joint investigations conducted by the Police Special Task Force (STF) and the Galle District Crimes Division.

title: Kohuwala shooting victim succumbs to injuries
byline: The individual who was injured in the recent shooting incident near the Kohuwala Junction in Nugegoda has succumbed to his injuries.

title: North Korea’s Kim Jong Un signals continued missile development in next 5 years
byline: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un signaled the country will continue to develop missiles in the next five years, as he visited major munitions enterprises in the last quarter of 2025, state media KCNA said on Friday.

title: 15 injured after stabbing, liquid spray attack in Japan
byline: Fifteen people were injured in a stabbing attack in a factory in central Japan during which an unspecified liquid was also sprayed, an emergency services official said on Dec 26.

title: NPP PS member arrested for threatening female Grama Niladhari officer
byline: A Member of the Puttalam Pradeshiya Sabha representing the National People’s Power (NPP) has been arrested by Mundalama Police early this morning (26) in connection with the alleged verbal abuse and intimidation of a female Grama Niladhari officer.

title: Bomb scare prompts special search operation at Kandy District Secretariat
byline: It is reported that a special search operation has been launched at the Kandy District Secretariat following a bomb scare.

title: Former Minister Douglas Devananda arrested by CID
byline: Former Minister and leader of the Eelam People’s Democratic Party (EPDP) Douglas Devananda has been arrested by the Criminal Investigations Department (CID).

title: Bomb scare at Kandy District Secretariat: No explosives found so far – Police
byline: A special search operation was launched at the Kandy District Secretariat today (26) following a bomb scare, however no explosives have been found so far, according to police.

title: Six arrested over showroom manager’s shooting in Ambalangoda
byline: Police have arrested six suspects in connection with the shooting and killing of a showroom manager in Ambalangoda on 22 December.

title: Three arrested at BIA while attempting to smuggle Rs. 8.6 million worth of goods
byline: In a special operation conducted at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Customs officers have arrested three Sri Lankan nationals earlier this morning (26) for attempting to smuggle a consignment of goods valued at Rs. 8.6 million into the country.

title: Three-year-old killed in road accident involving cab in Welipenna
byline: A three-year-old girl was killed in a road accident near the 5th mile post on the Aluthgama–Matugama Road, within the Welipenna Police Division.

title: Gampaha Crimes OIC remanded over bribery charges
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the remand of the Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Crimes Division at the Gampaha Police Station until January 06, in connection with an alleged bribery case.

title: Suspect arrested over shooting death of former Mulleriyawa PS Vice Chairman
byline: The Western Province Southern Crime Division has arrested a suspect yesterday (25) in connection with the shooting death of the former Vice Chairman of the Mulleriyawa Pradeshiya Sabha in Kotikawatta.

title: Met. Dept warns of heavy rain across several provinces from Dec. 29
byline: The Meteorology Department states that, as an active easterly wave is expected to move across the island from December 29, rainy conditions are likely to intensify, particularly in the Northern, North-Central, Eastern, Uva, and Central provinces over the next few days.

title: Original locomotive absent from ‘Tsunami Train’ commemorative run
byline: It has been reported that the original locomotive involved in the tragic Peraliya train disaster caused by the 2004 tsunami did not participate in this year’s symbolic commemorative run.

title: Arkansas Powerball player strikes $1.8bn jackpot on Christmas Eve
byline: A Powerball player in Arkansas won a whopping $1.817bn (£1.34bn) jackpot in a Christmas Eve drawing, making it the second-largest lottery prize ever claimed.

title: Google might finally allow Gmail users to change email addresses: Here’s how
byline: Google is preparing a change that could finally address a long-standing issue for Gmail users - having to live with an old email address forever.

title: Former Malaysia PM Najib Razak found guilty in state funds scandal
byline: A Malaysia court has convicted former prime minister Najib Razak for abuse of power and money laundering, in his second major trial for a multi-billion-dollar state funds scandal.

title: Election of new chairman for Weligama PS postponed again
byline: The process to elect a new Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, which has been marked by several controversial developments, has been postponed for the second time.

title: Ariana Grande breaks Spotify record on Christmas Eve
byline: Ariana Grande, the singer became the No.1 artist in the world, in terms of Spotify monthly listeners, surpassing The Weeknd for the coveted spot, on Wednesday (Dec.24).

title: 49-year-old doctor drowns at Mirissa Beach
byline: A doctor has reportedly died after drowning in the Mirissa Beach yesterday (25).

title: Seven youths arrested for illegal motorcycle racing in Panadura
byline: Panadura North Police have arrested a total of seven youths for engaging in illegal motorcycle racing involving monetary bets.

title: Legendary singer Latha Walpola passes away
byline: The legendary Sri Lankan singer Latha Walpola has passed away today (27).

title: Winter weather in US Northeast leads to thousands of flight delays, cancellations
byline: A mix of snow and ice bore down on the U.S. Northeast early on Saturday, disrupting post-holiday weekend airline traffic and prompting officials in New York and New Jersey to issue weather emergency declarations even as the storm ebbed by mid-morning.
